summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JP Morgan Chase Bank, dated September 3, 2019, demanding extensive financial records. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies, including violations of sex trafficking and related statutes, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Referred to in the subpoena and the accompanying declaration as the prosecutor requesting the records.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Contact person for the subpoena; records are to be produced to this agent at the FBI's New York field office.

persons.name: Forensic Accountant
persons.context: Contact person listed on the subpoena for questions regarding the requested financial records.

connections.description: Both are federal prosecutors from the same office (Southern District of New York) working on the grand jury investigation.
Berman's office (the prosecutor) is directing the subpoena, and the Special Agent is the FBI point of contact for record production.
Both are listed as contacts for the subpoena, indicating they are part of the investigative team examining financial records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which JP Morgan Chase is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI New York Field Office)
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
Indianapolis, Indiana 46231-1335 (JP Morgan Chase National Subpoena Processing)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies, specifically citing violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests JP Morgan Chase not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.

The subpoena demands an extremely broad range of financial records from JP Morgan Chase, covering accounts from inception to present, including wire transfers, credit card statements, loan applications, online banking data, and all related correspondence.
The document indicates a significant financial investigation is underway, targeting accounts and individuals associated with the underlying criminal case, likely Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
